ConfigNetStatus.summary: Configures the advertising of a CIDR block.

schema.description: The ID of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.
The CIDR block of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

The status of the CIDR block. Valid values:

*   enable: advertises the CIDR block.
*   disable: withdraws the advertising of the CIDR block.

The regions in which the CIDR block needs to be advertised or withdrawn from advertising. If you leave this parameter empty, the CIDR blocks in all regions are configured.

>  You can call the [QueryNetList](~~2639086~~) operation to obtain the regions of the CIDR blocks.

items.description: The region in which the CIDR block needs to be advertised or withdrawn from advertising.

schema.description: The subnet CIDR blocks of the CIDR block.

items.description: The subnet CIDR block of the CIDR block.

Code.description:
The status code.

*   **200**: The request was successful.
*   Other codes: The request failed.

ConfigNetStatus.title: ConfigNetStatus

schema.description: The ID of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

The status of the instance. Valid values:

- normal
- expired
- deleting
- stopped
The number of entries per page. Default value: 100.

Code.description:
The status code.

- 200: The request was successful.
- Other codes: The request failed.

Total.description: The total number of entries returned.

Num.description: The number of entries per page.

Status.description:
The status of the instance. Valid values:

- normal
- expired
- deleting
- stopped

IdcNumbers.description: The number of data centers. Valid values: 1 to 10.

IpSubnetNums.description: The number of CIDR blocks. Value range: 1 to 10000.

DiversionType.description: The diversion mode. Valid values: on-demand always-on

items.description: The details of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

Instances.description: The details of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

QueryNetList.summary: Queries the CIDR blocks of an anti-DDoS diversion instance.

schema.description: The ID of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

The CIDR block of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.


> If no extended CIDR blocks are configured for the anti-DDoS diversion instance, this parameter specifies the CIDR block of the instance. If an extended CIDR block is configured for the anti-DDoS diversion instance, this parameter specifies the extended CIDR block that is configured for the instance. If this parameter is specified, the MainNet parameter is required.

The scheduling mode. Valid values:

- manual: manual scheduling
- netflow-auto: automatic scheduling

The primary CIDR block of the anti-DDoS diversion instance for which an extended CIDR block is configured. If no extended CIDR blocks are configured for the anti-DDoS diversion instance, leave this parameter empty.
The number of entries per page. Default value: 100.

Code.description:
The status code.

- 200: The request was successful.
- Other codes: The request failed.

Total.description: The total number of entries returned.

Num.description: The number of entries per page.

SaleId.description: The ID of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

Net.description: The CIDR block of the anti-DDoS diversion instance.

NetType.description: The type of the CIDR block.

DeclaredState.description:
The advertising status of the CIDR block. Valid values:
- 0: The CIDR block is not advertised.
- 1: The CIDR block is advertised.

Region.description: The region in which the CIDR block is advertised.

Declared.description:
Indicates whether the CIDR block is advertised. Valid values:

- 0: The CIDR block is not advertised.
- 1: The CIDR block is advertised.

NetExtend.description:
Indicates whether the CIDR block needs to be extended. Valid values:

- 0: The CIDR block needs to be extended.
- 1: The CIDR block does not need to be extended.

PolicyName.description: The name of the mitigation policy.

DjPolicy.description: The configuration of the mitigation policy.

Mbps.description: The traffic scrubbing threshold in Mbit/s.

Pps.description: The traffic scrubbing threshold in packets per second (pps)

DDoSDefense.description: The DDoS mitigation configuration of the CIDR block.

FwdEffect.description:
Indicates whether the forwarding configuration takes effect. Valid values:

- 0: The forwarding configuration takes effect.
- 1: The forwarding configuration does not take effect.
- -1: The forwarding configuration is being deleted.

items.description: The configuration of the CIDR block.

Nets.description: The configuration of the CIDR block.
